abstract: cremo leads albany past bryant in 2nd half , 84-68 .
article: albany , n. y. -- joe cremo scored 24 points , greig stire had a double-double and albany pulled away in the second half for an 84-68 win over bryant on wednesday night for its best start in 24 seasons . stire had 11 points , 12 rebounds and six assists for the great danes . david nichols had 17 points , matching cremo with three 3-pointers as albany went 9 of 17 from distance . devonte campbell had 12 points . nichols had back-to-back 3-pointers to open the second half and stire had a tipin as the great danes broke away from a halftime tie at 37 .

cremo had four points in a 6-0 run that got the lead to 10 with 13:09 to go and he hit a 3 to start a 7-0 burst that made it 70-53 . cremo had 17 points and nichols 14 in the second half , combing to go 13 of 19 from the field . the great danes were 19 of 31 . albany finished with a 48-20 advantage on points in the paint . bryant , which has lost four straight , shot 34.5 percent in the second half and 39 percent for the game . brandon carroll had 15 points and ikenna ndugba 13 .
